chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Shelton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of extended supervision.  Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant Lawrence Shelton in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Disclosure by the court. No objections. State calls Officer Christopher Erickson sworn & testified. Cross exam. State rests. No testimony from defense. Defense moves to dismiss. Denied.   Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered. Counsel believes may be 2 day trial. Counsel and state to look at week of 1/12/15 as to witness availability. Parties to notify court on 1/8/15 of witness availability and dates chosen for trial and if matters will be consolidated for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Shelton in court, in custody.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel unavailable per FAX to the Court. Defense requests preliminary hearing.   Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Atty Last calls to inform that he is unavailable for 12/8/14 hearing. Will request preliminary hearing and temporarily set with clerk for 12/17/14 at 11:00am. Case will be called on  12/8/14
Letter from Attorney Last requesting an adjournment of 12/8/14 status hearing.   Scanned and forwarded to Branch 2 for review.

State appears by Attorney Patti Wabitsch. Defendant appears in custody via video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz. Counsel appearing as friend of court and waives reading of the complaint. Court finds probable cause. State requests $10,000 cash bail with conditions. Court orders $10,000 cash bail with conditions: No contact with S.S. and address and defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. Counsel waives time limits. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing. Status on preliminary hearing scheduled for 12-8-14 at 10:00 am.
